The ear cups are both comfortable and maneuverable, giving you the ability to swivel them for easy one-ear monitoring. The 45mm neodymium drivers are more than large enough...

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Overall, pretty good headphone for the price, surely you wont be disappointed. Nice feeling jack. Headphones, I don't know not too many features. So, after trying many different types of headphones, these are quite nice. They are very detailed and people say after the "burn-in" they'll sound nicer. I can say after listening to them for an hour you certainly get more used to them and start liking them more.
First Impressions were that the bass was good volume but seemed a little muddy and not detailed. Which why some people are complaining that they are bass heavy when they most certainly aren't in my opinion. The mids are really nice. The highs seem to shrill a bit. It's all preferance. Though they do really sound nice.
For example for people coming from Senn HD280's y ... ou'll definately love these more.
They feel decently comfy, but we'll have to see. The price could be better, but they are worth their money. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I use these for conventional I-Pod listening among other things. They have a strong bass-response, fluid and smooth; but not overpowering to the point it muffles or clumps up like the Beats do at max volume. Very well-rounded headphones that make any genre of music sound superb. Distinct Lows, Crisp Mids, and good Treble based highs. The best thing to do with these is to adjust your EQ depending on genre or sound you want (Live Music and Older Music probably can use some form of bass booster to induce richness etc) because after all, not every song was recorded in the same lab, and these headphones are used to identify all aspects. I use them on the bus and do wonders for outside noise cancellation, and will block 100% of noise when music is playing. These headphones are very loud, almost ... to the point of a mini-speaker when they are not covering your ears. Even when no music is on and you just want peace and quiet while studying or something, these will reduce all noise by 40-50%. The first time you listen to your favorite song on these, you will immediately realize how long you've been deprived. It brings out every note you never knew was in the song. They are great out of the box, but an amplifier will not hurt any either. For the money, you really cannot ask for anything better than these Audio Technica ATH M-50's. My only cons with these is the Pleather ear pads,and long cable. The ear pads will eventually deflate and lose padding after normal wear and tear due to sweat and just pressure from wearing them. I take these everywhere, and had to get new pads after a few months(which you can buy online for around 10 bucks). I got the coiled cable, and am very pleased with it as it stretches far beyond my expectations so there is no con for me actually. But i'm letting you guys know if you're planning on taking these places,just make sure you which cable you're getting. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Great Phones for a Great Price
Item.Review: They are powerful and sound great. Way better than Dr. Dre phones or Bose. I returned my Bose from the Apple store for these. Comparing the two side by side, it's not even in the same ballpark...the ATH-M50s blow it away. The sound-stage, volume levels, and bass are light years better. Only thing that wasn't as good as the Bose phones was the comfort level. The Bose phones are known for that and are really lightweight...but you're paying for the sound quality not the comfort in my opinion. These are the best phones for the price since the quality compares with phones that are a couple hundred dollars more! Get these if you are looking for headphones in the $100-$250 range. Also, i play drums and can play along to music without the sound of the drums entering my ears. Good sound isol ... ation. They won't disappoint. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: These headphones are beyond awesome if you ask me. One; They have above average bass. And good for people who enjoy bass in their music. ( Electronic/Dubstep/Rap ) Two; Block out a lot of sound. Sometimes I put the headphones on just to study or concentrate. It makes a good work environment. Three; The quality of the music, is 10/10 and clear and as crisp as anything i've ever heard. The plug-in for the headphones can plug into a regular mp3 device or some sort of studio hardware of your choice. I see nothing wrong with this product so far, and it's worth whatever price your paying for across the board. Headphones and earphones like Skullcandy are incomparable to this product because of the quality of the sound, and the materials used to make the products. The headphones themselves ... can swivel, which is handy in some cases. And the band can extend quite a bit, so your head size should not be a problem. The cord is stretchy and won't become tangled very easily, or at all. I rate this 5/5 considering this is probably the 4th set of headphones/earphones this year. And I'm hoping these headphones will last me throughout 2011. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: ATH-M50 are the best headphones on the market!
Item.Review:
Pros: Comfortable; Sound Quality
These headphones are the king of my electronic collection. I did a lot of research into different headphones, eventually coming down between this and a pair of Beyerdynamic can almost twice the price. The main audio signature that I was looking for was bassy and strong because I listen to a lot of electronica/trance/techno music so pounding beats were a must. These cans fit the bill exactly. Straight out of the box, they might be a little weaker than expected, but once you give it time to burn in, they really flourish. The sound is nice and round and very detailed. I can hear all of the synth and bass lines, and the vocals. I am especially impressed with the highs because there is so much bass response so I expected it to drown them out, but the high ... s are in fact very clear.
In terms of comfort, the ath-m50 is top of the line. The cups are a nice leathery fabric and are EXTREMELY comfortable. The headband is also padded so wearing them is a pleasure. If there was any negative that I could think of, it would be that the cups can get a little hot after a while and you might start to sweat. Besides that, these are the perfect headphones! expand » « collapse
Item.HelpfulCount: 1 out of 1 found this review helpful.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I've had mine for about month with over 100 hours of use. I mainly use them with my desktop and mp3 player (Cowon S9), unamped. These bad boys need burn in time. When i first heard them the highs were way too harsh and bass was non existent. But since I already knew this I just left music playing on them for a few hours, and the sound significantly improved. As many know, these headphones are known for having plenty of lows and highs, while lacking in the mids. I'm no serious audiophile, these are my most expensive headphones, but they sound great to me and can be driven easily. My Cowon S9 and even my iPod shuffle (3rd gen) can be used since these headphones have a low impedance. Although I thought the Zune HD had a problem powering them. As for size and fitment, I was very surprised wi ... th how big they are. As I stated before these are my first purchase of beginner audiophile 'phones. It took a while for me to adjust to their size and weight, but don't think they are uncomfortable. My ears do get warm after some use though. I decided to purchase these headphones on this site because of the price, coiled cable, and past good experience with B&H. The coiled cable is good if you want to use the M50s walking around with an mp3 player. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I received these headphones about a couple of weeks ago, and don't think I could be more pleased for the price I payed. I use them for enjoying music in my spare time, and at first the highs were somewhat raspy, and the bass a little weak, but after leaving them on all night and day, these are just what I expected. Every sound is discernible in the music, with rich highs and mids, and bellowing lows. The isolation is quite good, and when played at a reasonable volume, your music cannot be heard by others. For comfort, these are hard to beat. I've left them in for hours of easy listening. They seem quite sturdy as well, just by their feel, but I have accidentally fallen asleep in bed with them as well to find them completely fine (pretty sure i slept on em). I spent my last bits of cash on ... these cans, and can say in full confidence I don't regret it at all. There is nothing negative I have to say about the ATH-M50s, except that if you buy the uncoiled version like my brother, it's about ten feet long and somewhat of a nuisance.also, [...] Thanks B&H! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: My girlfriend and I both use a set of these headphones at work. They have good isolation, are very durable, comfortable, you don't need an amp to power them, and they sound good as well. They have good bass without being too colored, decent soundstage for closed-back phones, and are accurate but not boring. Since I first got them, my co-workers (music editing) have started to get them as well. I've had them a couple of years, replaced the pads once and they were like new again. Although they are not the end-all, beat-all of headphones, they are really good phones for the price.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: They are very clean and detailed. Great bass extension. I like them almost as much as the Denon D2000s. Very similar sound to me. A decent headphone amp is required to get the best sound and bass response from them. They work great in my home studio for monitoring and are pretty accurate. Soundstage is a bit smaller than the Denons and way smaller than my Sennheisers but they are closed back so that's expected. The mids are very slightly recessed but most do not notice this. Also they do seem to take a while to burn-in. Give them at least 24 hours of solid use before you judge their sound. The highs were a bit harsh at first and they sounded a bit sterile when I first got them. I would not hesitate to buy these again.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I saw many reviews on these both positive and negitive. They are great. I had some skullcandy aviators before these and the ATH-M50's blow them away. They make listening fun again. Songs you have heard a thousand times sound almost new again. The highs and mids are crystal clear and the bass is tight and powerful. I would recomend them to anyone.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Once I decided to purchase a nice pair of headphones, I started to read every review and forum that I could find. After about a month, I narrowed it down to the ATH-M50 and the HD 280 Pro. My final pick was the M50, and I am glad I did. Overall the M50 has very good build quality and feels solid in your hand. The cable is thick but flexible which makes it easy to stretch out for a longer reach without worrying about breaking it. I was worried that these would be too small for my head (about 23 in circumference) but they fit very nicely and can be worn for many hours without becoming uncomfortable. The sound quality is excellent but i highly recommend using a EQ for listening to music. There is no coloration in the bass (if you are looking for a beats replacement, this is not it) a ... nd the treble is very crisp just like the midrange. The M50 requires high quality music for a good sound, I am currently in the process of re-riping my CD collection as AIFF at 1411 kb/s. Any bitrate less than 450 kb/s will not allow the M50 to shine to its fullest potential. Listening to 320 kb/s or below, you can hear small crackling noises and some muddy-ness in the music that you would not hear with lower quality cans. With high bitrate, it sounds like you are actually in the studio with the band/ singer you are listening to. On many of the Yo-Yo Ma tracks, you can actually hear him breathe while playing. One of my friends said that these were just a bose knock-off. I had him listen to them and he quickly agreed that the M50 was the best headphone he had ever heard in his life. Keep in mind that people associate quality headphones with Beats and Bose so you will have to show them differently because these blow the competition out of the water. Overall, I am very pleased with my decision to buy the M50 and would highly recommend them to anyone seeking a very high quality pair of headphones without spending more than 200 bucks. Right now I am at about 50-75 hrs of use. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Great sound, but a little uncomfortable
Item.Review: Some headphones are so light and comfortable, you hardly know you're wearing them. These aren't that type. You wouldn't want to use them for everyday listening, or go to sleep wearing them. But, they excel at critically listening to music. On a commercially-released Nora Jones track, I heard a soft little rattling resonance at one point on the left track. Concerned that the problem may have been the headphones, I swapped that signal to the right channel, and then heard the rattle in the right ear. The headphones were working perfectly! That little noise was on the recording. Listening to other artists, some sound better than others, but that's life. If a track is clipped, or the dynamics are over compressed, you'll hear the distortion; and if instruments are randomly placed in the s ... tereo field, you'll hear that, too. The impression I get with most commercial tracks is that I'm hearing what was heard in the studio control room. Also, pristine live recordings can sound very good. Concerning bass, there is a test signal I have with a click track over a bass sine wave that slides to progressively lower frequencies. When a speaker can't handle the low bass, you can still hear the click track. The bass on these headphones was smooth and audible all the way to the end of the test track, which is better than any speakers I own. Concerning the closed-back design, it doesn't completely eliminate external sounds, but it does reduce them enough to improve the signal-to-noise ratio vs. open phones. About me: I'm a computer programmer with an engineering background. I sing in church choirs and a community choir, and sometimes make amateur recordings of live performances. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: The amount of detail they provide are scary..at first they sound shrill and harsh, very bright. But after 6 hours of burning or so..this is what I can report. I don't hear a smudge of high frequencies for high hats, but the individual hit hat cymbals hitting each other..so clear it's just amazing. I can hear strings flapping against the frets on acoustic guitar and bass guitar. I can even hear finger picking noises and snare drums sound wonderfully complex and detailed with a good amount of the actual snare into it. The fit is snug, although a bit tight, and isolates outside noise well. The design is beautiful, modern and shows this is something of great quality. Bass is great and there is more than enough even for the most hardcore bass drum or bass guitar, the best thing is that it's go ... t great transient response so the bass is not muddy, but incredibly accurate. These cans transform every bit of signal into true frequencies. They are very sensitive to EQ, and can make your brain go fuzzy for a while if you crank the bass at certain right frequencies. I would pay more for these..I'm rediscovering my entire music record again with details I've never heard before! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: These phones are amazing. I've never made a high end headphone purchase before, but I am pretty stoked with these. Reading reviews I saw that a few people were complaining they were too flat which had me worrying that they'd sound like the old cheap Sony phones they are finally replacing (which I now know had a domed--i.e. boosted midrange--sound profile). Not the case. These m50s have amazing sound that is accurate across all ranges and volumes. Bass is strong, mids are well-represented and the highs are crystal clear. I've been breaking them in on music like Nightwish, Rammstein, Kasabian, and Justice. The M50s sound absolutely amazing with Atreyu's and Protest the Hero's double bass slams. Live recordings sound phenomenal, almost like you're there. These phones capture the dark sound ... of the various metal genres I have. I'd say these compete with Beats by Dr. Dre, and they're less than half the price. The ATH-M50s are at least on par with the legendary Sennheiser HD-280s (which my roommate has.) Definitely two thumbs up. I think I'm going to have to listen to my entire music library again. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Contemplated a lot before i bought this. I own a set of grado sr60. The grado sounds great, but it's an on the ear headphone and it just beats me why grado won't work on the ear cups! half an hour with those cans and your ears scream for freedom! comparing with sony mdr7506, the ath m50 cost about 20$ more, but worth every cent you pay. the construction is more sturdy and the overall frequency response outshines the mdr7506. mdr7506 delivers higher bass and treble but falls short of the ath m50 in the middle and lower frequency ranges. These cups work great as gaming headphones too! playing gears of war 2, you can hear details as minute as wind blowing through the alley. The bass and treble response was better than a seinheiser NR cans my friend owns. Put on some classical music and thes ... e cans take you live to the concert! the vocals and instruments sound just great! overall, an amazing headphone! Don't own a bose, but am sure this would give a tough fight for any headphone in the price range. The isolation is almost perfect, the frequency response is great across the band, comfortable and best bang for the buck! i can't come with any metaphor to describe how much am enjoying these headphones. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I've had these headphones for a couple months now and they sure sound great. They are my favorite pair of headphones now and really provide the best sound that can be had for headphones under $200. They are totally worth the price, Audio-Technica did not skimp in making this product. I heard from some people they are a little bass-heavy which is totally not true. They provide the best mids and instrument seperation I have ever heard and the bass is very clean and punchy. With a little bit of EQ, bringing the bass up a tad, these will sound better than Dr. Dre Beats Studio edition. The rotatable cups are a very cool feature and they are quite comfortable too. The only improvements I can think of are the leather pads do cause some people's ears to sweat, mine personally are unaffected. I wou ... ld also like to see a detachable cable in case a replacement would be needed, you could just order the cable. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: just as good as everyone says!
Item.Review: Great headphones! Clean bass and smooth mids/highs. I have been very pleased with this purchase. This a great example of a product of really good quality for a decent price, sadly something that is almost never offered by manufacturers anymore. Generally, we pay astronomical prices for trash produced for pennies overseas. Because of the price, I have purchased several pairs.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Audiotechnica ATH-M50 is great sound for a good price
Item.Review:
Pros: Sound Quality; Available in coil or straight cord; Comfortable; HIGHLY Adjustable
Cons: muted mids
These headphones are humongous if you've never bought expensive headphones before. As you get into audiophile quality or more professional studio quality, you tend to see more of the larger sizes, and this is no exception. However, much of this size is due to padding, which makes it comfy for your ears and top of your head. It does clamp down a bit for people with wider heads, so stretch it on a few books or a computer tower for a couple days.
The sound is clear and detailed. The mids do sound a bit muted, which makes it feel like you're sitting in a 3 foot bubble. The soundstage is not too big or bright and I suppose you could say you're halfway back in the orc ... hestra level. Stick it on a decent amp that likes mids and it'll put it in a good range - the clarity make it ideal studio cans and the comfort makes it wearable for at least a few hours [not THE most comfortable, though]. If you can find it for a good price it is well worth it. I'd say the only things that sound better at a lower price may be Shure IEMs.
The earpieces swivel and fold this way and that and fold compact - it includes a bag too for easy travel. Available with a coiled cord [like an oldschool telephone] or straight - makes no difference in quality, just preference]. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: First off, let me say that I have not used an over-the-ear headphone for over 30 years. I have been using on-ear or in-ear headphones for the last few decades. I have recently set up a new digital audio workstation and wanted a pair of over-the-ear headphones to: - spare my family having to listen to me mixing music; - have a high-quality alternative to my monitor speakers; and - provide more comfort over longer periods of time than my in-ear headphones. I have been using my new ATH-M50s for a couple of weeks now and am generally very satisfied with them. I tried a few other over-the-ear headphones in this price range and think the ATH-M50s are a great value for the price. I found them a little tight and thus somewhat uncomfortable at first, but I was able to loosen the fit a bit by leavi ... ng them stretch across something (one of my speakers!) that is a few inches wider than my head when I am not using them. Now they feel great. The build quality seems very solid as well. The sound isolation is fine for my purposes - not only can my family not hear what I am listening to, but I am generally undisturbed by the noise they make while I am listening through my ATH-M50s. Note that I am a notoriously tough grader... I gave these headphones 4 stars because I think the sound quality is quite good, but not mind-blowing. Perhaps this will improve with some burn in period. Response is strong across all frequencies, and I am really enjoying the feel of the bass when compared to my in-ear 'phones. I guess based on some other reviews I was expecting the sound to be more crisp, more clean. Don't get me wrong, I think these ATH-M50s sound great, but to get a perfect 5 stars from me would require them to sound amazing. I would highly recommend these headphones for the price. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I use this mainly to listen to music off of iPods and computers. These sound great with excellent bass and clarity. They are perfect for enjoying the music you have on your digital players. The only thing I didn't like is that they get uncomfortable over time. Overall, it's a great product for a great price!

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Why pay for much more expensive noise cancelling headphones, when you can have great sounding headphone? I have compared these to the Beats by Dre Studio head phones and these by far are a better sounding headphone than the Beats. Great lows, mids, and highs. These are very high quality as well. Take into effect the cost benefit of these headphones and it's a no brainer.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I don't claim to have a ton of experience, but in the limited amount of experience I do have, these are easily the best headphones I've ever used. The sound quality is superb, the bass is deep without being skull-jarringly loud, and they're incredibly comfortable. They have a very reasonable size and weight, and the ear cups are great. I imagine these 'phones would be ideal for studio work, but I'm not sure if the isolation is good enough for live DJing in a loud club environment. I haven't had the opportunity to test them in that type of situation yet, but at the very least the isolation isn't bad. Highly recommended!

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I use these for listening to my iPod exclusively and love their fit, comfort, and sound quality. I find them lighter in weight than expectations and love the padding for te top of your head. Yes, the ear cups do tend to retain heat, but not until after 60 min. of use. At just at [$] the price was very impressive.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: For anything from casual listening to BluRay movies, the ATH-M50 are a superb pair of headphones. While comfortable, they also provide excellent sound range and bass. They are well worth the meager asking price.*Keep in mind they're anything but portable.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: My first pair of headphones over $50. I can't compare it to anything personally, but I did a ton of research and if you do any bit of research yourself you will quickly see that these headphones are top notch. They sound great to me, I use them daily working in a science lab all day, they are comfortable and fit well. If i had to say anything negative about them I would have to comment about how it doesn't do the most amazing job cancelling out sound and you really have to turn up the volume to drown out background noise or if you like a truly immersive listening experience like i do. I have a pair of in the ear headphones that seem to do a better job at cancelling out sound without having to turn the volume up too high. It's not too bad though. Comfy, sounds great, folds up nicely, coi ... led cable is something some people dont like but I like it compared to a super long straight cable, nice carrying pouch. Mostly plastic, but seems sturdy enough, time will tell. I like how the cable is reinforced with a metal coil by the headphone jack. The quality is in the sound they say, I am not much of a headphone guy so I cant make comparisons but I wanted what people are saying is the best and they are saying its ATH-M50. They do sound good to me. I was originally going to purchase beats by dre, I figured since everyone was buying them they had to be the best. I was happy to find out that these phones were rated as being better at about half the price expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I use this product for personal listening with my ipod or at my computer, while im walking to class, sitting on the bus, etc. My experience with these headphones so far has been great. They sounded stellar out of the box and the 40-hour break in has only made them sound better. They have a full, but not boomy bass, as well as overall even and fair representation of mids and high notes. Using an amp or audio card via computer really enhances the bass, but even with just an ipod it is sufficient and never muddy. For sound quality these are excellent headphones. They are also very comfortable, though for extended use in warm environments they can cause your ears to get a little sweaty. I dont have a problem sleeping in a chair with them or listening to them for several hours at my computer. ... They also feel much more durable than my last pair (sennheiser HD 448). I tried a pair of sennheiser HD 448s for about a month and they fell short in about every way. The Audio Technica have better, smoother, fuller bass, and at least equal quality mids/uppers, though probably better if i had to choose. They feel more comfortable, isolate better, and feel much sturdier, especially the cord and headphone jack. For another comparison, I would say these Audio Technica are like the Sennheiser HD280s (which I had for two years and absolutely loved) only with fuller bass and slightly slimmer. Compared to Audio Technica ATH AD700, they have a clearer sound, a cleaner sound stage IMO, and sacrifice a modicum of comfort to be much more compact and weildy. For the price these are the best headphones Ive found, and have been happy with them in just about every way. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Ok, so my experience with over the ear headphones is pretty limited. I owned a pair of Sony's around 10 years ago that lasted until the wiring broke down. Before and since then I've mainly owned ear buds for portable music listening. Well, got sick of using them at work so I did some research to find a good pair of over the ear headphones. I sit in a cube so I didn't want the open back style nor did I want to spend a bundle on noise cancelling cans. This pair seemed to be the perfect fit. They are built well, although I wish they had some kind of spring tension on the earpiece swivel. It rotates too easily when taking it out of the storage position which makes for extra work to make it right. No biggie though. The coiled cable is awesome for use on a desk. Keeps the work area nice a ... nd neat. Ear pads are comfortable but get sweaty on me after some time. I'm a sweater though so it may be fine for you. As for the sound, it's natural and clear with no artificial extra bass. So much better than earbuds there is no comparison. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Short review: Awesome! Longer Review: So far the sound has been great. I was looking for a great pair of headphones for a decent price. So I consulted my DJ friend and he pointed to these w/o question. So I read many reviews and almost always it came back to this set as being the best for the price. I have had them now for about 2 weeks and can say so far I love them. They fit comfortably, are great to transport thanks to their folding, and sound awesome. From everything I read they get even better sounding as you burn them in. So I have that to look forward to. For those that worry about style, I can say these look rather nice and imo look much better then the trendy Beats. Speaking of those, I tried many headphones at the Big Box stores including the various Beats...and these beat the ... m hands down in both price and quality. On a side note, I do highly suggest getting the corded. I was unsure when I got them, but a friend suggest I would regret it if I didn't. I will say I am so glad I got them corded. The ease of use is awesome. If I am at my desk it is nice to not have a mile of cable laying everywhere to trip over or grab stuff. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: These headphones are really amazing. I'll be fully honest with you though. As far as recording there not the best because there not a flat response headphone. they have more bass than what you'll hear on a mix through other speakers. I read as many reviews as i could before getting these and let me tell you all the negitive reviews people have been throwing out on the interweb are either due to the reviewers having no clue what there talking about or they just got a random bum pair. "I got these and there super uncomfortable and dig into my 'normal sized' head". Yeah who's to say your head is normal sized when hundreds of other people didn't have the same problem? i'm just saying if your a big electronic music fan or you dj then BUY THESE! the sound is crisp and the lows are insane. I'm st ... ill working through the 100 or so hr burn in time on mine so i'm expecting them to get even better. So don't believe the negitive nancys. these cans are crazy nice and cheap for the quality. The gold plated plug is nice, the screw on 1/4 plug is nice and pro status, it swivles more than anyone will ever need (except maybe djs). Cord's not long but plenty long for anything but recording in a studio. Sturdy! and they don't weigh a billion pounds like so many say. Not crazy expensive esp if you shop around. if you want a sick pair of phones to listen to your electro then throw down 140 bucks for these. it's worth it. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: It is a comfortable headset, easy to wear. Ear cushions are large enough and do not press on your ears. Sound seems very simple and natural, without exaggerations in any part of the spectrum but this is just my personal impression. They provide good isolation of the exterior sound and work well for moniroing the recording sound. There are cheaper Sony and Senn sets that are also popular but I do like the M50. The coiled cord on this one is convenient when I want to sit close to the source and don't have to deal with a bundle of cord on teh floor.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I use this product for mixing audio for music and film (in addition to desktop monitors) and on location monitoring. These headphones have exceptional range, and you can hear the difference. The sound is portrayed accurate and true, enabling the possibility for reliable mixes. The cost of course, is a big up. I've read some people complain that they're expensive. To them I suggest listening to a $100 pair of headphones and critically comparing it to these. Pitching out a little extra money goes a LONG way with these and compared to the more expensive variety, I believe these to be inexpensive for their quality. They are lightweight, but not cheaply made (yes they are plastic, but not plasticy... It's a trade-off that needs to be made for them to be light weight) I was pleased they ... offered a coiled cable, for I own a pair of Grados and the uncoiled cable often gets yanked in ways that scare me. Wearability is also a big factor for me, as there will be times in which I will be wearing the headphones for hours on end. Make no mistake, ear fatigue will definitely occur if your mixes are sub-par, but one can easily listen to un-nuked music for hours on end with these. As well, their overall comfort on the head is incredible, and I will at times forget they are there. The closed back design is a plus, but that of course is a preference. For me, the closed back aids in keeping noise in just as much as keeping noise out. At times I will be in the same room I'm recording in, and the last thing I want is bleed from the headphones to the microphone. These headphones prevent anything of the sort (at reasonable levels). In all this is a great product. I would highly recommend it for on location monitoring, studio monitoring, and even pleasure listening. I did receive them as a gift but if they were lost or stolen I would definitely buy them again. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: awesome headphones! These things sound epic! so much clarity and depth which really adds to your mixes. They are pretty bass heavy so i've adjusted to backing off the bass a little in mixes. Really solid feel. They're very snug and comfortable, i can go hours of mixing without having to take them off. great for the money!

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Best Cans in this price range.
Item.Review: I use these headphones everyday for video editing and electronic music production. I couldn't ask for more. flat response, strong bass, comfortable after hours of use, solid construction. These should be twice the price. Great for home computer music production. The low impedance makes them perfect for un-amped headphone jacks on computers and sound cards.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I recently purchased these headphones for film editing and leisure purposes. The sound is crystal clear and it has a great bass response. What I really appreciate is the sturdy yet compact construction. These are to replace a pair of Sennheiser headphones that broke because they were only constructed with plastic. These are very durable and made with metal. My only complaint is that after an hour or so it gives me a headache because the metal band is tight at the top (and I have a small head compared to most...) Otherwise, an excellent buy for the price!

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I use these headphones for small amounts of mixing (at night, when using my studio monitors would wake the neighbors) and for general listening and they perform wonderfully. I don't encourage mixing with headphones, but when you've got no other choice but to do so, these work well. Their sound is honest and isn't colored. The bass isn't too heavy either, but still has a definite presence without any crackles. Increasing the volume doesn't equate to a blown-out sound. As far as noise isolation, they do a fairly good job. I have a pair of Sennheiser HD 280 Pros and they definitely keep noise out / sound in much better. I'd say if my HD 280 Pros scored a 10 in noise isolation, the ATH-M50s would score a 6 or 5. Again, though - these are great headphones and, from what I've heard, a st ... andard in many studios when it comes to obtaining flat and honest sound. Also came with a nifty little carrying pouch... helpful while traveling! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Sound Quality worth its price and more!
Item.Review: DJ, Production, Home Studio Very good sound quality and bass. Must be burned in however before full time use. Excellent build, quality, portable as they are able to be folded, comes with carry case. Amazing, very affordable for the price.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: This pair of headphones is exactly what it was supposed to be: good sound definition, decent sound isolation, right amount of bass, heavy duty metal jack. Coiled cable is a must if used to walk around with an audio device. I wear them all day long at work and they are really comfortable. Nothing bad to say for the moment.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Sound Quality; Comfortable
The Ath-M50 is the aging flagship of DJ headphones off audio-technica's line. Its design is simple, heavy plastics bound with metal adornments and will easy withstand much abuse. Add in some soft quality pads, and these headphones are very comfortable even after long periods of usage. As for the sound quality, you will be pleasantly surprised at how well these perform given their relatively low price point. The sound quality is comparable to some mid end around the ear cans, which speaks a lot about its quality. It has a deep full-bodied bass, decent mids and crisp treble and presents a well-rounded sound that is only complimented with its strong durability comfort and isolation. However, although it states that these headphones are portable (heck, t ... hey were even designed to be foldable), their size is somewhat bulky and can attract some stares when commuting due to their size. Despite that caveat, these headphones are definitely worth the money and a great starting pair of headphones for the budding audiophile. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Completely love the ATH-M50's I bought. Comfortable on your ears for hours and hours, brilliant true sound - with full bass and crystal clear highs. Mids brilliant. Also great for use when DJing. Flexible and compact. Couldn't be happier.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Pros: Excellent sound, very comfortable. True response across frequency spectrum - other headphones of comparable price and reputation that I tried seemed to have artificailly boosted bass frequencies. Cons: Straight part of cord could be a little longer, but this is no big deal - sound and comfort are what counts.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Having owned some cheaper varieties and even some Sennheisers, the build quality of this pair is very nice. It fits snug on your head [if your head isn't too big, but they can be stretched] and only gets uncomfortable on your ears if your ears naturally stick out, and only after about 4 or more hours at a time. The sound was surprisingly not heavy handed in any way; if anything the bass wasn't as punchy as I thought it'd be. I've had some cheaper Sony studio headphones before and they were still a bit punchier, but in effect the sound is a lot clearer and detailed - allowing you to hear every note. It doesn't give you the presence of being there like Shure IEMs do, but the ability to take these off easily and even share it for a short listen is something you can't do with IEMs. I'd sa ... y it feels like there's a thin 3 foot bubble surrounding you with sound originating everywhere beyond it. The sound isolation is pretty good - not superb, but it is a closed-back so it cuts out most small to moderate background noises. If you want to not be able to hear the person next to you at all, get IEMs - even the low end Shures saved me through college, and they sound great out of the box if you can get used to having something shoved deep in your ears. I haven't owned enthusiast headphones like Grados or more expensive Beyerdynamics so I can't compare too much. Overall I do like these very much and I think the bottom end is evening out - and hopefully that 3 foot bubble closing in - as I reach the 50 hour listening mark. One thing I did read about the M50 is that they need a burn in period of up to 50 or so hours to sound their best. Oh and another thing. It does transfer any noise originating from your source - a usb DAC will eliminate the noise floor if listening from a not-so-great source like a computer. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: great, versatile headphone at low price
Item.Review: I purchased this headphone from B&H at a low price. [...]Seriously.... this headphone sounds amazing! I personally have a pair of BOSE QC15 headphone. got it for over 300. however, in terms of sound, M50 totally outplays the QC15. Impressive bass response, beautiful mid and high. I primarily use M50 in my home recording studio. Before i get the M50 i used bose around-ear to record. shifting to M50 makes me get a lots more details than before. i can now hear so much more details of the music. helps a lot in my recording.besides recording, i found M50 is also really a enjoyment to listen casually. it has a low impedance, 32ohm if i am correct:) so that means u dont need an extra headphone amp to drive them. just plug the 3.5mm headphone jack directly into your laptop, iPod, and u are rea ... dy to rock!it also has a rugged tough looking. the only down of them is it's a little heavy after extended time of use. but considering this is a studio headphone, this is not really a big issue.Totally loves it. strongly recommend this headphone to bass lovers(not the low quality, out of control bass u hear from the beats) who are also looking for a relative flat frequency response closed headphones. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Sound Quality; Available in coil or straight cord; Long Cord; HIGHLY Adjustable
The Audio-Technica - ATH - M50 professional headphones are by far one of my favorite headphones to date. The sound quality is amazing, the headphones are loud enough to listen to without putting them on your head. The bass quality is great and definitely makes for a well rounded out and clean sound. When i first opened the box and pulled out the heapphones, i thought that the headphone jack was just the big one, but i found out that i could screw that part right out and have the regular jack as well. now i use my headphones for my ipod and my guitar amp. i love that these are also dj headphones so they work very well on a turntable as well. These are great headphones especially for the price that y ... ou can get the for. The one problem i have with it is that if i wear them for too long my ears start to hurt and get sweaty. Overall i recommend these headphones to anyone who likes to listen to music. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Great sound for the price. Kind of a flat tone, so it's great for EQ'ing music targeted at run of the mill ipod headphones. A bit on the heavy side, and they get stuffy after long studio hours. but, other than the case it comes with only being a carrying case, i'd consider it a great buy. however, you do want to keep in mind that they are a little flat, unlike some of the 'boosted' headphones (like Beats)

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I have compared both beats by dre and the shure 750dj. ATH M-50 are will rounded speakers. Beats just drown out the rest of the frequencies with their bass. 750 dj was slightly better than the beats. If you are looking for a great pair of cans look no further. Also the M-50 was the cheapest price out the three.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Exellent headphones at a good price.
Item.Review: Excellent headphones. I have used the Bose headphones (over-ears, not on-ears) for over 10 years, until they broke apart. The Bose were not sturdy enough, but the ATH-M50's are. The Bose sound good in a lot of respects, but I like the overall sound of the ATH-M50's much better, at a fraction of the cost.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I couldnt be happier with these, burned in about 40 hours so far. I started with ipod earbuds, moved to JVC marshmallows, akg k81 dj, and now I finally got some real headphones. They sound amazing straight from the ipod, or electric piano ( i keep thinking that the speakers are on when i have these on because they sound so good). I like the cable on one side, because its easy to distinguish left from right in the dark, but i feel like it might be unpleasant to replace once it breaks. They have a durable, but plastic feel to them, the coiled cable is a nice feature. Sometimes i use them as earmuffs because they're so comfortable (and hot). I replaced the pads with some turtle beach X11 pads, terrible idea. Bass is deep and warm. I could ask for a little more treble sometimes. Have you eve ... r tried Dr beats, or Bose headphones in a store? To me they sound rich so so much better than regular ipod earbuds, thats what these are like but more balanced. A must buy. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I am a student living in close-quarters in a dorm room so I needed headphones that wouldn't leak like my Grado SR80i's and would be comfortable for long periods of time. These fit the bill perfectly and sound awesome. I listen to all types of music, from hip-hop and electronic to classical and jazz. They sound great for everything. The response is clear through the whole frequency range and they have great bass response even without amping. My only gripes are that it does not have a detachable cable, and that the headband gets slightly uncomfortable after long periods of wearing.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I use the product mainly for listening to music, usually from my computer which has 7.1 audio hardware, so I am sure I get the fullest of these headphones. They are so crisp and clear, which they also have the right amount of bass accompanying, not too much and not too little. They are very sturdy, easy to package up and go (also given the pouch to place them in), but the only thing that I really dislike about them is that the metal coil came loose. Not sure if that affects the quality of anything, which I doubt, because I haven't noticed a quality drop yet. Overall, these headphones are excellent for any usage. They're advertised as studio headphones, but I use them for non-professional studio usage and enjoy them completely.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Best phones since the AKG K240DF, which is a studio standard. Audio is pristine. Smooth frequency response; clearly articulated highs, solid bass (not boomy); vivid mids. These cans are excellent for monitoring and live mixing (not aware of another set that can actually be used for same with good results). They're great for singers, as the closed earcup eliminates bleed into the mic and greatly reduces outside noise so you can really hear yourself without going deaf. Switching to this product for all my studio phones.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: nice earphones at a good price
Item.Review: I bought these headphones for my 14 year old. I got the coiled cable, as recommended by other reviewers. That was a good advice, making them more convenient to use. These headphones are bigger and seem more durable than the slighter, sleeker versions available from big-box retailers. My son did not mind that, and praised the sound. One of the slimmer, streamlined, demo models at the retailer had a broken ear-phone. I am glad for the heavier design, and my son did not complain. These are heavier than headphones you see on professional athletes and air travelers but, they are comfortable, sound good, and, so far, appear very durable. Don't be alarmed by the jack. It comes in a screw-off version. The bigger size allows you to use the earphones in older stereos. It screws off a sm ... aller jack that fits into ipods other mp3 players. I like this versatility. expand » « collapse
Item.HelpfulCount: 0 out of 1 found this review helpful.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I use these every day, and they sound great. Bass is great, and they muffle the outside noises so that you can focus on the project at hand. The earpads allow for comfort, no matter how long you plan on being in the studio.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Great Sound Quality for the Price I Paid
Item.Review: I am not an audiophile, or sound professional. I don't own high-end or high-priced audio/video equipments. All I want is to listen to my good old 30GB iPod video in morning and evening commutes. Headphones I own or owned ranging from cheap street vendor earbuds, iPod earbuds, Sony MDRXXXX(don't remember), AKG K77, Koss PortaPro, Koss QZ99 to this Audio-Technica ATH-M50. Due to loss of hearing, I had to turn volume high for those cheap Coby & JVC, and even iPod earbuds. But, for ATH-M50, medium is enough. With ATH-M50, those pre-set equalizers in iPod do make differences when listening to different kinds of music. Compared to AKG K77, ATH-M50 makes much more clear sound, especially, in highs. I am not going to compare ATH-M50 with Koss QZ99 since QZ99 is more for noise-reduction to me ... . PortaPro is quite close to ATH-M50 in term of sound clarity. If you own Koss PortaPro, you may want to buy a pair of ATH-M50 for living room or sound room listening. Audio-Technica ATH-M50 headphones to some might be an overkill for listening to iPods. To me, they work just fine. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: The sound quality is wonderful especially when bass is necessary, you can literally shake these off your ears if you want. The only complaint I have is that after 1-2 hours of use the pressure around your ears can be uncomfortable but for the price you couldn't recommend another pair.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I'm amazed by the price/quality ratio for the headphone. Surely there is better at higher price, but not sure at this price. I really love the clarity of the sounds. I'm not an audio expert but do some mixing and liveshows from time to time and these are really useful and gives good result.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I spent a good deal of time in the store at the headphone wall. Carefully trying to distinguish between the sets. I had some bose quiet acoustic headphones for years until the leather got pretty worn out on them. I wanted something that didn't use batteries and was over the ear (to reduce noise naturally) I was fully expecting to buy the non noise canceling bose set, and was almost sold until I compared them to these Audio Technica's. The sound, especially in the bass was really full and clear. I've been using them for a few weeks now and am still very pleased.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Can't wait to discern my audio while shooting- well maybe I can. So far theres a little bit of a pinch on my head but thats cause I'm listening for enjoyment. I cant imagine it'll phase me at work too much. I like the isolation of sound with the closed back. The sound feels good. I dont know what more bucks would buy but until then Im happy to have new ears. Gonna dust off my stacks of wax he he he.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I bough this headphones to use it in my pc to listen to music, play games, watch movies. I received great reviews and motivation to buy then so i went ahead and did so. They are comfortable, output excellent quality of sound and i have never seen another headphones that perform better than this for the price.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: i have been using this almost exclusively with my electronic drum kit, and they are by far the best headphones i have used so far. great isolation and sound reproduction, and comfortable to wear. i have gone through 2 Sonys, 2 Sennhausers, and 1 Bose headphone and these are the BEST.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Good quality audio. Very comfortable, I tend to be picky about this. After burn in these do become unbiased headphones... letting you listen to what the person who made the song wanted you to hear. The bass has a different feel then I'm use to, but I enjoy it. Only issues I have is that the cable doesn't detach and people in the state of Florida can't buy the B&H warranty. So if it breaks you'll have a big issue... though it does come with an Audio Technica 1 year warranty. Also no mic, but you don't buy headphones like this for a microphone. Best headphones under $200-$250 as far as I know. The coiled cable is the perfect length letting it be able to rest in my pocket if I want to walk around with these on. Stretch length is still very long too.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Really no competition for the price
Item.Review: This product is second to none. I have researched for hours seeing which sub-$200 headphones would be the best in terms of aesthetics and, more importantly, in terms of audio quality. If you like headphones such as Beats, this is NOT for you. These let you hear EVERYTHING in your music, not just the bass and the singing. Plus, if you have a decent amp, you can ramp up the bass so that they sound like a bass monster. Overall, these headphones are perfect for anything whether it be casual listening or for studio monitoring, and, when paired with a decent amp, the possibilities are endless.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: best cans below $150! heck, best below $200! building a budget computer audio rig needs a lot of research. i was surprised you could get a lot of quality equipment on a tight budget. scouting around on a lot of forums, the ath m50 kept popping up. i think its the most widely recommended cans for its price range. i'll leave out comments on audio and build quality. just do your research. what i'll do is recommend this to anyone looking for headphones out there. great product!

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I have straight-cable and coiled-cable sets of these, and I like the coiled-cable for sitting at the desk, straight cable for long runs across the room. Either way, these beat out anything I've ever tried at anything close to the price range. Awesome phones: excellent isolation, comfort, dynamics, and frequency response. Translates extremely well with nearfield monitors. These are studio phones: they benefit from having a legit headphone amp or audio interface-- iPods and laptop soundcards might not have enough juice to produce volume and dynamics. They are also pretty bulky for around town listening.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: These headphones are great. amazingly clear sound and good bass. and by good bass I don't mean bass that will rattle your head and drown out everything else. That's not the definition of good bass.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I purchased the ATH-M50 headphones as a gift for my wife before Christmas knowing that I will be using it quite a lot. I was initially looking for other brands, never knew this one existed. Once I tested them at B&H I knew I had a winner. Four months later, we are stll amazed with the design, clarity and rich, deep bass. Plus, headphones are easily adjustable and feel just right on the head. Subway rides aren't boring anymore.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: This, my friends, is an excellent set of headphones. I use them for long hours of music listening, and additionally video gaming. The ATH-M50's are extremely comfortable. After as sessions of 6 or so hours of gaming, and browsing, they still feel great. They mold into your head and ears and it just feels like the music is playing in your head and not from headphones. As far as quality goes, I'm no audiophile but they sound beautiful. The bass on them is great and they kick fast during rock. Unfortunately I don't know the dynamics or inner-workings of music to provide a more in-depth analysis on the sound quality, but it sounds great for movie-watching too. The cord is a nice comfortable length, with a spring connected at the jack to prevent the connection from diminishing. There are no ... known cons to these headphones as far as I'm concerned. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I've owned a lot of headphones that I use while recording and mixing guitar, percussion, drums, vocals, piano, etc. I was looking for a nice, even response, good isolation to prevent a click track / monitor from bleeding into the mics, and comfort. These satisfy my needs perfectly. The frequency response is nice and wide, so I can mix with these and my studio monitors to have a good sense of the sound. I highly recommend the coiled cable; it gives you a bit of warning if the cable gets caught on something instead of ripping them off your head. These are excellent headphones at a very reasonable price. I highly recommend them.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: i recently purchased this headphones after hearing and reading good reviews about it. I wanted to have a decent one for my desktop audio system. The sound was very good out of the box. Some say you need atleast 50 hours burn in though. Im really impressed with th sq- very detailed, good bass, wide soundstage. Highly recommended for hp below $200.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I am a very novice user, who is now treading into the pro arena in both Audio, as a musician, and Video, as a camera/editing for my company. I needed a pair of headphones that encompassed three areas, 1. Comfort for LOOOONG hours filming 6 hours sessions. 2. Quality of sound for mixing both live and studio audio, and 3. A good price, since lets face it, you can spend upwards of $500 in a great set of headphones. Well, these have slam-dunked all three! They are comfortable, awesome for mixing...as our guitar player put it My headphones sounds like I am listening to a walkman, where as your ATH-M50's sound like I am standing in a room with my AMP! The price can't be beat for the quality you get.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I've used these headphones for about 2 months with home recordings and they offer top notch sound. They allow you to hear a clear crisp sound, very crucial for recording. Very compact and easy to transport. Screw on adapter is also a very useful tool. 110% satisfied.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I've been a Senheiser & Beyer phones guy since the 70's. I wanted a closed back phone for live sound use, that was more portable and cheaper than HD580's. I wasn't expecting to be so impressed with these. These phones sound amazing. Considering the price, they're a steal.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I am using these headphones for listening to my voice over recordings. I am using a Neumann TLM 103mt, pro tools 9 w/MBox mini, Focusrite ISA One analogue pre-amp on an iMac computer. The sound is crisp and clear....I can hear the details that I need to hear. The only problem that I have is that the headphones are a bit heavy and my ears get quite warm after just a few minutes of use.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Before I bought these headphones I checked out several reviews and read a few blogs. I was not sure if I could trust the online recommendations--but there was a consensus that these headphones were a great value for the money. I am a professor and don't make tons of money--so these headphones were a big purchase for me. I love them--they reproduce a colorful range of clear, distortion free music (even a levels that are not safe for protracted listening). My only suggestion is that they start shipping the headphones with a stereo adapter plug that can reduce the male end to a mini-plug size that could let one connect these headphones up to Ipod. That is a small complaint... overall I love the space for sound they create in my brain and the precise reproduction of music that fills that ... space. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Exactly what I was looking for
Item.Review: Bought these for casual music listening, and was looking for a quality set of headphones to offer accurate sound, without loosing the excitement, as I have found some headphones do. These things do exactly that. the sound is very accurate and flat, but they are still capable of pumping out plenty of bass when needed. Frank Sinatra and Black Eyed Peas both sound fantastic on them. Build quality is great. Only issues at all are that they clamp pretty hard out of box, but that is easily fixed, and they can make your ears a bit sweaty. accurate enough to satisfy all but the most critical ear, and can be EQ'd to heavier bass than a pair of Beats. A+

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I use these headphones for my home studio and they sound great. They do have a rather long burn in time, but after a few hours they begin to warm up. The frequency response is pretty flat, which is what you want from a pair like these. I can also see myself using these headphones outside of the studio, like on long trips. It comes with a nice carrying case too. Overall great investment, and for the price, you can't get any better.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Great Headphones - for the music lover
Item.Review: This headphones is not the last word in clarity, detail, soundstage, (insert audio gear reviewer adjectives here). But what it lacks in all the fancy reviewer-speak is the ability to produce music that moves you: head-bobbing, booty-shaking, body-moving music. If you are more interested in adjectives, skip this one. If you are interested in music, you can hardly go wrong.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I specifically needed a closed back quality headphone. While using a high sampling rate, and with instruments earlier recorded under the lowest noise conditions, and, then, with my vocalists singing into very sensitive quality microphones, the last thing that I wanted to do was to allow the vocalists' microphones to pick up their own headphone monitoring. The ATH-M50 provides a quality signal to the vocalist that rivals my main monitors, while completely isolating that sound from the microphone pickups. It just happens to be pure fluff that the M50s are good enough to do comparison master mixing against the main monitors, small monitors and the famous car stereo test. That will only add to their studio use and final value!

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I can get enough of this headphones. I use them for monitoring in a recording studio. They are amazing! Excellent sound definition, very clear. Even though they are a little big, they are easy to use and lightweight. I love them and I trust A T on their products. Thank you. Christian.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I've just bought them yesterday. I've been working with sennheiser eH350, which I dont like cause they are bassy, Behringer hpx2000- no like because they are uncomfortable and accentuate the mid-range, american audio HP700- they just don't sound right. I bought this AT and when I get home I found that they really colour a lot with the bass response. It's really, really hard to squeeze a natural sound from them. I can't beleive I could get faster and better Eq's, mixes, and masters- broadcast quality- out of my cheap cheap cheap and flimsy Motorola MOTOROKR EA2 cellphone earplugs. I don't know why they are so well rated. They are uncomfortable and by 20 mins of use you start sweating annoyingly. I want my money back and try another ones- maybe AKG 240 are way better. Bad for me.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: The ATH-M50s are a great sounding pair of professional monitor headphones. What is particularly impressive is the fantastic bass response that is very tight and detailed. Midrange and treble are crystal clear and the headphones remain clear and with low distortion even at high volume levels. They are very comfortable to wear for extended periods. Their external noise suppression is also pretty good. My main use is for mixing and live monitoring in my home studio. Overall I am very impressed with the ATH-M50 headphones. [...]

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I'm not an audiophile at all. I use these headphones primarily with my Ipod and my computer, and they are awesome. I listen to mostly hiphop and electonic/dance music, so bass quality and quantity is very important to me. These headphones are excellent in that department. Highly recommended.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I will repeat what everyone else says about these headphones. Excellent set: 1) good noise isoluation 2) wide spectrum 3) good spacialization 4) bass is very accurate but punchy 5) value beyond belief
Item.HelpfulCount: 1 out of 1 found this review helpful.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I listen to ATH-M50 out of an external usb DAC (basically sound card). The headphones are very analytical and defined across the frequency response. Soundstage is okay. The only thing that I didn't like is the bass seems overwhelming to me. Mid-bass is good and tight, but the very low bass is kind of bloated/muddy. I might only think this because I've listened to better and more expensive headphones before. I am not a basshead, but I assure I like to hear bass in my music. The ATH-M50 does a good job of letting you hear the presence of the bass, the thumping.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: 1) Build quality is excellent. I also own equivalently priced AKG's & Beyers and these phones are easily superior - they feel like they will last a *long* time. 2) They do sound a bit dull out of the box. I read elsewhere that they need to be broken in, so I plugged them into a radio at a reasonable volume for 2 days straight and this made a huge difference. 3) Overall sound quality - I'd say 8/10. I've heard better (a old pair of Sennheisers I once used at work), but as an all-rounder, with the added advantage that they're closed back so I don't have to worry about annoying people, these are right on the money. 4) The bass on these phones is outrageous - I've never heard others (including closed-back ones) sound like this. That's not to say I'm a bass-head or anything, but if bass is ... on your wish list, these are definitely your cans. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: The headphones sound really good. My only complaint is with the fit. They are a bit loose for me -- and I don't have a small head. I use the headphones mostly for listening to music on my computer or ipod. They make me regret waiting so long to upgrade from the earbuds. Helps block out the sound from noisy roommates, but not so much so that you're incapable of hearing anything form the outside world.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I have been researching online and in stores for months for a new set of closed style cans for travel and home theater/stereo use. These are simply amazing for the $$$. I auditioned Senheisser's, Grado's, AKG's in the $200-$400 range and these cans sound better IMO than all of them for a closed style can. They are crystal clear, punchy bass, and have beautiful separation. Don't hesitate to buy! Best [$] I ever spent;)

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Great product. Sound is terrific. Was going to buy the Dr. Dre headphones but saw too many reviews about how fragile they were. The reviews on these headphones were great and the price was better [...]

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Audio Technica ATH-M50 may be best for the price
Item.Review:
Pros: Available in coil or straight cord; Comfortable; Long Cord; Sound Quality
I purchased the Ath-M50 a few weeks ago and have since gotten sufficient burn in to write out a review. I must say, these things sound phenomenal. They aren't my first pair of expensive headphones, but they are my first set of over-the-ear phones. As any professional review will tell you, the highs and lows are very strong here, leaving the mids to sound a little recessed, but they are by no means overly weak.
Aside from the astounding sound quality, I'll talk about the structure. First of all, these headphones have a closed-back design. This means that they are padded, and surround your ears in a fashion that a little bit of noise from leaking in or out. This makes it good in noisy environm ... ents, or when you don't want to bother other people with sound leaking out. The downside of this that it sounds a little 'in your head'. If you want the opposite of this, check out the Audio Technica AD700s; better sound stage, more sound leak.
The headphones feel a little uncomfortable at first because they squeeze your head a little (due to the closed design), but after using them for several hours, it gets more comfortable. I also feel that the headphones are very sturdy and will not break.
I recommend the coiled cord version of these phones. The headphones these replaced also had a 10ft cord, and it always ended up getting on the ground and getting stuck in things. The coiled cord works great!
Definitely recommend these phones, just don't pay $160 for them. You can find them for ~$110, $100 or less if you're lucky. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: This wonderful and durable headphone have a lot of volume, extended bass response, smooth top frequencies and, the best, an amazing stereo image to a headphone. It seems its drivers are more away from the ear channels than other headphones and that seems to improve the stereo image because it's better than my Sony MDR-7506. And it handles 1600mw of Input Power! A monster! Great for drummers and Sound Technicians that need a true reference every night across the whole world. The design is also great and the possibility to reverse a cup so you can monitor with only one side it's great also.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: As far as headphones go, these are much more balanced than the equivalent more mainstream (and expensive) beats, Bose, and to a much lesser extent, sennheiser closed headphones. These headphones have taken everything I've throw at them very well, including games, rock, classical, jazz, alternative, dubstep, and metal. They do improve slighty after burn-in, the sweetspot for burn in appears to be between 24-48 hours, but that's very debatable, as earphones don't truly ever finish burning in. Sound: these cans have good and clear mids and highs, and the bass is slighty more emphasized. The bass isn't by any means overwhelming though- it's punch and defined, so you can hear each note rather than a muddy mix that tend to come up with many similarly priced headphones. Contruction: these headph ... ones are very solidly built. I have no doubt that they will last me for years to come. Initially, some people find that re headband may be a bit tight, but stretching it out over a computer case or something like that fixes it quickly. The earpads are comfortable for extended listening, but they can also cause your ears to heat up a bit in combination with the pressure. I don't find myself noticing this very often. On the other hand, they do an excellent job of keeping my ears warm in sub-freezing weather. The headphones fold up for easily storage, and can be bought with a coiled cord (highly recommend if you will be wearing these around, it keeps tangle at a minimum). While on your head, they'll draw some looks, but they look snazzy enough that you won't mind. These are an excellent buy. There are better sounding headphones out there for the same price, but they are all open headphones and come with substantial noise leakage- these have none. These are easily driven by an ipod / iPhone, a headphone amp might clear things up slightly, but it's not really worth investing in one unless you plan on moving onto another, much more expensive pair soon. expand » « collapse
Item.HelpfulCount: 1 out of 2 found this review helpful.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I use the Audio-Technica M50 headphones for long gaming session. They are very comfortable.The sound quality in these headphone is amazing it picks up all ranges of sound even bass with out the distortion of other sounds. And mostly they are built very well and can take a beating. I recommend them to everyone.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I bought this for Christmas about a month or two ago, and it has far exceeded any other headphone i have owned in sound quality. The mobility of these headphones are not that great since they are large, but do have a folding option. I have never owned ear phones over the price of 30 dollar so i was a bit unsure of what to expect but I am quite satisfied with it. I use the earphones mostly on car rides or when im doing school work which probably averages t about 2-3 hours a day. The cord is quite long (I have the curled one).The earphones isolate a lot of noise naturally through the ear cuffs. For example, when i drive in the car with my parents and they turn on the radio, i put on my headphones and turn on my music, i cant hear theyre music as well as them talking. After long periods of u ... se the headphones will become a little uncomfortable. Its comfortable to wear otherwise. Bhphotovideo.com is the cheapest you can buy these great headphones. Something that will make these headphones better is if they added some buttons on the side which could lower or increas volume and buttons that could switch songs, like the itunes headphones. I wouldnt recommend this to someone who wants to use this with their ipods and walk around , only djs and recorders should use this in my oppinion because its too much of a fuss to carry around since its big and bulky. You do need to wear them in with an mhour or so of run time, then you can hear the headphones true beauty. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I am a budding audiophile and in no way an expert. Still, I have a fairly good ear, and I think that these are a fairly solid pair of headphones. The base is wonderful. It is tight and strong. Acoustic instruments and mid ranged voices also sound good, although sometimes the volumes of such voices are a bit lower than they should be. Overdriven guitar does not sound that great. It is overly crunchy and sounds a bit more like noise than music through these headphones. These headphones are also not easy on low quality music files. Physically they are sharp looking and comfortable.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: THIS IS A GREAT HEADPHONE VALUE!
Item.Review: I bought the M50 primarily for use with my IPOD based portable headphone system, but have discovered that it holds its own very well with my in home systems. Easily driven by any type of amplifier, very sturdy, and smooth, somewhat forward sound with a little bass emphasis. Only drawback is that even folded up, it is a little bulky to haul around for travel, but this is a minor inconvenience compared to the sound quality. Strongly recommended.
