Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Studio 'phones for the rest of us!
Item.Review: I am a hobbyist but used to be a pro. I used the Sony's for years and liked them but always thought they were uncomfortable. I have used the mid-priced AKG's and a Beyer once many years ago. What I needed was absolute truth about the basic aspect of my mixes without spending $300 plus on headphones. I also do some re-mastering of vinyl to cd for myself and others, so being sure that there is no detail that might be missed is paramount. I am quite surprised at the difference in overall detail from the Sony cans I have been using. The comfort in these phones is much much better (though still not as comfortable as the AKG's). You can indeed wear them for hours but the isolation of outside sounds is not as good the Sennheisers (though the difference is not much). I have been using them ... for about 60 hours straight with only a little break (had a backlog of stuff I needed to get done with these!). I live in a situation where I can only check the sound with my monitors a couple times a week so I am wearing phones all the time when in my studio. I also have checked the re-masters I've done so far on audiophile systems at home and a friend's house and these phones don't hype the sound; it translates very well to speakers. I feel strongly that for the money, these are a better sound than the comparable Sennheiser and AKG. Needless to say, I won't be using the Sonys much anymore. An excellent value overall with great treble extension and 'non-hyped' bass response. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I love these headphones. They are great and produce ridiculously good sound quality for the price. (No need for overpriced beats). My ears do get a little warm but its really not a problem. GET THEM NOW.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Comfortable,Durable,Good Looking,Good Sound,Powerful
Great pair of headphones. Put them on the first time, and noticed how comfortable they fit. They do tend to make me ears sweat after about an hour usage, but this is expected for most headphones. They look good, and the cord is definitely long enough.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Bought to replace travel headphones, but now mostly use the M50 connected to the computer while editing photos or just surfing! Sounds great. Construction is great. The cord attachment to headphones seems secure and not flimsy. Sound is outstanding even with equalizer set to flat or off. I would only suggest getting some sort of earpad covers because as most over-the-ear closed back headphones get a little warm/sweaty after extended periods of listening. I just got the ones listed in the accessories, Headphone Softie - Earpad Covers (a little over priced for such simple things), but they work great. Feel I've stepped up in the headphone world.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Take pleasure in ATH-M50's exclusively during personal times when I need to take flight from life's trials. Depth of sound striking, covering a notable range. Will have to adjust to tension, as fairly close fitting.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: They do what they are supposed to do Not much to talk about. the earcups are soft and comfortable Block outside sound pretty well. Seem to be built well Not too expensive or I wouldn't have bought them

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Comfortable,Good Bass,Rich Sound
I use these headphones for my digital piano. These headphones offer rich sound detail and texture. They are a snug fit against my head, but they're actually comfortable--even for long sessions.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I've had brands like Sony, Technics,Allan & Heath, and the first thing I noticed with these headphones was the crisp sound. Right off the bat the sound was bright and crisp. Had never picked that up with other headphones. They aren't the sturdiest feeling ones,maybe I just think that because they are the lightest ones I've ever held. Nice clean finish to them as well. I would definetly give these a shot if in the market for new monitors. Price is good and quality is great. Will buy them again, maybe another pair to have one for school and for home.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I have no complaints about these headphones. I have tried the Beats by Dre and both headphones are very similar. The beats have a little more bass and isolate exterior noise better. BUT, they require batteries, cost almost triple the price of these, and leak a lot of noise - they woke up my wife while I was listening to them at 2 A.M. The m50's don't leak much noise and sound great. The price is what sold me.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I had owned Beats by Dr. Dre before and they just stopped working. I was listening to music and they just died. I did some research and decided on ATH-M50. They are so much better and cost half as much. They are awesome!

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I have owned the ATH-M30 headphones for a year now but needed something more comfortable to wear longer. The M50s are more comfortable than I hoped for. The ear pads are much more durable and thicker. I don't even feel my ears touch the inside. Because the pads are made of a fake leather material they isolate the sound much better as well. They do get hotter to wear due to a lack of air movement. Compared to the M30s I noticed a 7db lift around 12khz. The sound seems incredible clear. I'm sure these are more accurate. The folding feature might help some people but personal I love the 180 degree pivoting ear pads. As always B&H had the best price around.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Honestly, I don't think you could find any other cans sounding as good as these for a similar price. Apart from the Grado SR60i & SR80i, nothing even comes close. These benefit from a closed-back design, effectively eliminating sound leaking from the cans and ambient noise coming in. These are kind of large & heavy, but that doesn't bother me at all. The metal band hand to be stretched a bit so they weren't clamping down on my head. I gave them a while to burn in as well.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Best Headphones I have ever used
Item.Review: The Audio-Technica ATH-M50's are by far the best Headphones I have ever used. It is obvious to me that the goal of these phones is to produce an accurate, flat sound, and these do a heck of a job. They don't have the overexaggerated bass like Beats. These are just great headphones for any kind of music: Acoustic, Rock, Classical, etc. Also the screw on 1/4" adapter is very high quality.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Great product. The bass is great. Very durable and comfortable. My first pair I ordered had the left ear phone go out within 5 days, however I believe the headphones were defective. B&H are currently sending a new pair as I write this review.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I use my new ath-m50s a lot now that I got them, they fit pretty comfortably, they sound amazing, not too much bad to say about them, one thing is they sound much better in an amp,the bass is pretty punchy but not overpowering and nice highs and lows! I would def recommend this product to anyone looking for great headphones at a great price

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Accurate headphones are easy on the ears
Item.Review: I got these to replace an aging set of Sony MDR-V6 headphones. The ATH-M50 was recommended by an audio professional and he was right on the mark. They're much more accurate than the Sony MDR-V6's, with mid tones that aren't harsh. This, along with their physical design, makes the ATH-M50's easier on the ears and the eardrums.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: The only bad thing about these headphones is when I look down they seem to want to slide off. they don't actually fall off. maybe it is my head! Great sound, great quality, good price on B&H too!

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Very very good sound delivered by this product, however the headband hurts the head a little on long-term use. Other than that greaaaaaat product and ridiculous price for sound quality.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Wish I had bought these sooner
Item.Review: I use these at night to play my electric guitar. I'll also be using them for mixing my own home recordings. I bought these to replace my old falling-apart Sony MDR7506 headphones and I'm glad I did. They are definitely more balanced and natural sounding. The Sony's are a bit on the boomy side. They fit comfortably but do seem a bit bulkier than the Sony's.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I use these in the studio as well as for casual listening. They are very comfortable and sound exceptional. Very natural sounding. I would be tempted to mix with these.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Read alot of headphone reviews, and all came up positive on the Audio Technica M50's . Ordered them and they did not disappoint. Use them with my Imac I7, MacBook, and iPhone. Sound is very clear with perfect amount of bass. I really believe that the way the music is produced, is the way it comes through these phones, unlike other premium headphones, which add or take away from the listening experience. Awesome sound for a great price (no one could come close to the price, especially here, to the North) . [...] Very stress free experience and will definitely go with these guys again.John

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I am writing this review more about b&h as the headphones are a gift so I can't use them and write this review about them. I ordered these headphones yesterday and they were delivered today for free in perfect condition. The price was the best offered anywhere online or in stores. Overall amazing service, and I already know the product will work great.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I bought the ATH-M50s to replace my Sennheiser 280Pros I use for listening at home and traveling. I find their sound slightly warmer and the bass definitely deeper and more defined. In addition, the M50s are lighter and more comfortable. I find no real fault with these great sounding headphones.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Avoid these headphones. In just over a year 3 sets all are bad. Not one of them sounds the same as the others. They might as well be 3 different brands of headphones. The coiled cord is way too short. You'll need an extension cable sitting two feet away from where your plugged into. There is only a couple of feet of straight cord coming from the headphones and then it coils almost all the way to the end. It makes the cord too short to be used without an extension cable. I bought three pairs of these just over a year ago because, I wanted everybody in the band to be hearing the same thing. And they were great at first. We do a lot of late night apartment headphone practicing. Now one set is louder then the others, one set has a lack of low end compared to the others. The other night m ... y lead singer was complaining that he couldn't here our keyboard player, and in my phones it was like a piano lounge I couldn't hear anything but the keyboard. And the third set sounds muddy, like theirs a blanket over them. When after just over a year multiple sets sound so vastly different from each other. That's what I call an epic fail. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: The only thing that I,personally do not like is, that the cable itself is not removable. That's it! Otherwise, I am very satisfied with the construction and sound.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Do your research & trust the reviews.
Item.Review: I use these as a part of my 3 point mixing/monitoring setup that includes avantone mixcubes & krk e8's... these 'phones sound stupendous & my mixes translate perfectly. i have 3 other headphones: they will ALL be replaced with ATH-M50'S asap.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: recording in a home studio, it gives a decent flat sound. Didn't try to mix with them yet. I'm trying also the burning in process, just to see if it would make any difference.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I spent an afternoon in my local music shop testing moniters. But each sounded so different than the other I was left frustrated. Then I saw the AT Studio Monitor phones. I own several of their mics and headphones, so I know their quality is outstanding, so I ordered these new phones as mixing moniters. I was anything BUT disappointed. The clarity of each frequency is so close and intimate with your ears that it takes your breath away. I could also tell that they did not "fluff" the sound, trying to make the mix sound better than it was. I hate dishonest monitors. I used these AT's exclusively before sending off my album for mastering. In short, these AT's don't just work, they work very well for a better price than most.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I used to use a small bass rig at home to practice between gigs and rehearsals. I didn't like the setup because I obviously couldn't simulate stage levels. I do use a Pod X3 Live as my preamp/direct box at gigs, so I tried just using the X3 and couple a different pairs of phones at home. Even my high end HD600 Sennheisers would crap out on the low B. I was ready to give up on headphones until I tried the M50s. These reproduce the lower registers at very good levels with no problems. Obviously my Sennheisers are much flatter and more accurate, but the AT's do bass guitar very, very well. They are a little pricey and can get a little warm after a couple of hours, but I'm very please over all.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: These headphones blew me away when I first put them on. I was so used to the sound of my Sennheisers that I didn't realize what I was missing. Don't get me wrong, the Sennheisers are great phones too, but they are lacking in the low mids and therefore sound light in the bass area. Putting on these AT's made me realize how much information my music has in those frequencies. These headphones do not hype the sound in any way. They have a very realistic "organic" sound quality to them. It's like being right there in person. For the money, you simply cannot go wrong!

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: if you like bass, and on a budget,get a pair of these now! there is a trill factor with the bass,make sure you burn them in,about 200 hours.bass is over powering and boomie.tightens up as you break them in.the mids and highs are pretty good. these blow the grados, and senns out of the water.imo.i would call them the poor mans denons (D2000S}.i also have amps,two portable and a desktop.with a ipod,if you want loud hard hitting bass get a amp.a good budget amp is a fiio e9 [$]you get a nice beginer set up that would be hard to beat. rock on the 5 stars are based on price and the bass you get.i know there are better cans but for $120 good luck.if you dont like a lot of bass and more into mids,highs,grados may be your thing,they really shine there....all depends on what you like. [...]

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I am using these headphones with my Nano player while at home or walking the dog and of couse video editing. Very comfortable design, great sound quality, one site wired, no amplifier needed. Do not like: Folding is a bit confusing, Wire cord is made for the studio work and about a foot too long for everyday use.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Swivel on the earphones is smooth. Take a bit of breaking in, but once they do, they sound phenomenal. One petty complaint I have is that the leather on the head strap wrinkles while wearing, but the earphones look so good nobody will take the time to even notice!

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I use this product in a home recording studio. My other pair of headphones are Sony MDR-7506. The Sony's are a studio staple, but they are quite bright. The ATH-M50 is quite a bit darker, which allows me to hear when my mixes do not have enough high end. The two headphones compliment each other very well. The ATH-M50 has a very clear bottom end and great spacial clarity (the way things are panned). There is a lot that I can hear on those headphones, which I can not hear on my Sony headphones or on my monitors. The isolation is also great if you want to record loud instruments, such as drums without having bleed. If you are a vocalist who likes to hear themselves when recording, you might want to look towards headphones that allow a little more bleed than these, unless you are alrig ... ht hearing yourself back through the computer. The headphones come with a quarter inch to eighth inch adapter and there is a spring system at the end of the headphone cord, which keeps you from pulling the cord out of the adapter (one of the ways that most headphones will break). Overall it's a great buy, if it's going to be your only pair of studio headphones or an addition to a collection. They are also quite fun for leisure listening and I imagine would be quite comfortable and quiet on airplanes. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I am newbie to headphones. It is very good headphones with crystal clear sound. I hear the sounds I have never heard with other headphones. I would definitely recommend to buy.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I'm no audiophile but these sound great to me and that's what is important. Using with an iPod to listen to classical music primarily but other tunes as well. They sound clear and pick up a lot of detail that I don't get from my regular speakers. With the closed back, the rest of the world is tuned out so I can enjoy without disturbing my family. I have turned off the EQ on the iPod and do not see a need for an amplifier at the present. Just real happy with this purchase.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Like everyone has said, these have amazing sound quality and great guild quality! This cannot be emphasized enough, but I don't just want to state what everyone else has said. Instead, I will mention the two cons I came across. The first is that they really do clamp to your head. After about half an hour wearing them, they became a bit uncomfortable, however, this was fixed easily simply with use and by leaving them over one of my speakers at home. The second con is that for some people, the top of the headband seems to put all of the downward pressure of the headphones on one point. So, after a while, it can become extremely uncomfortable. My solution for this problem was simply to wear the headband toward the back of my head. I doubt this works for everyone, but also the problem does no ... t occur to everyone. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: For a closed headphone they sound good. The bass is not overpowering like some closed phones. They are easily driven from just about any headphone jack. I use them when I am in bed listening to the radio and they don't leak sound so they don't bother my wife.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Great headphones...a bit pricey as I am used to $50 headphones, but I thought I d step it up a bit and treat myself nice...great sound, but I think I m going to buy that little Fiio amp for a little something extra.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I use these as my high-quality travel cans, complimenting my Ultimate Ears Triple-Fi 10vi's...and replacing my former portable cans: Bose On-Ear. There's a reason these headphones continue to sell out. They perform well above their price. In fact, they blow just about everything under $250 out of the water. They put my old Bose cans to absolute shame. I've had an opportunity to spend time with the various Monster Beats offerings, V-Moda Crossfades, a few Sennheisers and a couple of Denons (1100 and 1001 in this case)...the M50's blow them all away. Considering all of those cans cost more, it's quite the accomplishment. They could sell for twice as much and nobody would blink an eye.In fact, the M50's compete for my attention with my Denon D7000s and Sennheiser D650's. At a fraction ... of the price. No, they're not as good as the D7000s or HD650's...not should they be...but they hold their own and are more portable than either making them worth their weight in gold.As far as specifics:-They isolate well.-They don't bleed much sound at all.-Deep, rich bass (maybe too much if you don't like bass)-Highs are detailed, mids ever so slightly recessed-Sound stage isn't the broadest-Live music is not quite as great-Electronic music (Electronica, Hip-Hop, Pop, Dance) are superb.They've won a place among my catalog of really nice cans and are worth every penny. I'll recommend these for the foreseeable future. I think they're the best deal in headphones today. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: As good as everyone said they would be
Item.Review: I read tons of reviews before purchasing these headphones, and these turned out to be just as good as everyone said they would be. They have great sound, are comfortable, and not flimsy like some others I have tried.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I use this while creating my own music on my synth and the computer. I also use them when I play my electric guitar. The sound is excellent and does not let any outside sound in, even when the dogs are barking!

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Incredible sound - even from an MP3 file
Item.Review: The first thing that blew my away about these headphones was the bass. I got the same overall sound quality from my ipod that I get with my $400 Boze sound dock and better bass ! Then I plugged them into my Denon amp at home and wow! I'm not an audio technician - just a guy that likes his music to sound good. Buy them - you won't regret it.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I'm not a musician. My use for the ATH-M50 is Voice Over. I'm not all that interested in what sounds good, I'm much more interested in what sounds bad. If my voice is not good I want to know it, and these headphones do the trick. [...]

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I use the headphones for Voice overs. I find it essential to be able to hear yourself in your true voice while delivering a script. These headphones do the job and their not even burnt in. The reviews were accurate and honest. Happily I believed them and was rewarded accordingly. A word about B&H. I checked their prices against others on the internet and they were the best buy. After purchase I was able to track my purchase easily. Upon arrival I opened the box and was pleased to find my product enveloped in large bubble wrap to minimize possible damage [...]

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: These headphones are way better then what you pay for the only complaint is that they get a bit uncomfortable after a while Also I would recommend paying the extra[$] the coiled cable i got the straight and it gets in the way and tangels but overall im really happy

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: At first they made my ears feel warm, but now that I've gotten used to the M50, I don't even notice any warming. I wear these for several hours while working, and they remain comfortable throughout!I'm not an audio engineer or audiophile, but I do enjoy balanced sound that is not too bass-centric (Beats), yet does not distort hard hitting bass when necessary, nor alters a familiar actor's voice when listening to movies.The M50 does a reasonable job of isolating outside sounds too, just don't expect noise canceling like in some Bose headphones. The cord could have been a little shorter, but I understand these are more for studio use so not a big deal.The 1/8 plug, however nicely/purposefully built, has a wide contact base that makes using the M50 with devices with cases (ie. iPhones w\ case ... s) impossible without removing said cases. My iPhone does not have a case, so it may be a problem for someone else.I'm very happy with these headphones, and would recommend it to anyone. I also look forward to using the M50 for monitoring when I get into DSLR video. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Good Sound,Powerful
These headphones were a welcome change from the AKGs I'd been using to listen to mixes in my home studio. They're quite a bit louder, and the closed design shuts out some exterior noise. A little on the heavy side, but they seem sturdy and reliable. Great sounding, as well.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: The first time I put them on I was amazed that such relatively inexpensive phones could produce such sound quality. I'm in college and I wear them all the time when I'm going to class, and they've been crammed into tight spaces and dropped and yet they look, feel, and sound as good as the day I received them! The only drawback? They spoil you.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Excellent quality, but hot on ears
Item.Review: I am not a professional, but I use these with my computer at work and at home. Fidelity is top notch. They do get warm on the head after more than an hour of use, but they are otherwise comfortable.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: These have replaced the Sony7506 for us.
Item.Review: We use these both for soloing channels on our live sound board and reference checking on our live recording rigs. They have better noise cancellation than the Sony 7506 and a better low end response. They cover the whole ear and feel more comfortable.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I have an editing system in a noisy area so a nice set of headphones is a must. These are high quality and reduce much of the ambient noise. However, these headphones will put the SQUEEZE on you. I have to switch between ear buds, and use the M50s for critical work only. I wear them for a long period of time, I will get a headache.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: As a studio musician, I spend a lot of time with headphones on. I do a lot of comparing with my monitors. These cans are not biased. They do not have that box, mid-range thing going on. Smooth highs, great lows. If the music sounds good in these head phone, it sounds good on my monitors.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I feel that they do what I need them to do-----------To give me an accurate different perspective. A producer friend of mind suggested to give them a 24 hr burn in at a moderate volume level. I'm easily able to distinguish the frequencies I'm looking for. Keep in mind, it is in my opinion to import a reference track of a well known or well produced song similar to your music when mixing. That way one can easily hear the frequency differences between speakers and headphones. Hopefully that communicated well for you. I gave it 4 stars because there are no far gone conclusions in live.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Coming from a pair of Sony V6's, these cans did not blow me away as I had come to expect after reading so many reviews. The Sony's are much brighter and have better mid frequency response. I find the lower bass solid from these and almost identical to the response given from the V6's. However, the M50's are quite comfortable and I have had no issue with hours of constant usage unlike my Sony's. I have burned them in for about two weeks of dynamic playing and have noticed only a slight increase in mid-upper freq response. For that reason, these headphones do not expand my listening experience compared to my tried and true V6's. These headphones are a little over hyped and over priced IMO. With that said, the build quality is fantastic and stylish. I like the shorter cord and low impedance ... so I could technically pair them with my iPod if I so wished. I am biased towards a brighter sound since previous use of the V6's, yet these cans are far from bad. To each his own. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I use these to mix, track, and for FOH work. I have compared them to Sony 7509 and Beyerdynamic DT 770Pro. The M50 has a smoother more natural response than either of those.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I've only been listening to these for the past week at work and I'm happy with my purchase. The speakers seem to be well balanced and punchy enough without the usage of an amp. I'm using them mainly for work playing pandora from my mac pro. These headphone are also comfortable enough to wear all day.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Audio Technica just hit the bullseye with these phones. No particular reason (cost, titanium drivers etc etc..), they just created a great set of phones at a reasonable price point. The M50's were recommended to me by another pro audio engineer who said Buy these now...that's all his email said! As a pro audio engineer and composer I use these phones to check reverb, balance and stereo imaging in mixes as well as enjoyable music listening. They are accurate and well balanced across the frequency spectrum and they are very solidly constructed.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: These are very good sounding headphones for both music and voice. They not only sound great but are quite comfortable, especially for a portable design. They seem very well built and have every indication of lasting a long time. Even comes with a carrying bag. The only thing I would change is a better quality of covering for the ear pads, these seem like they will be the first thing to go.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I use this these phones just for listening to music. They are a little bulky, but the sound quality overpowers that. I can hear all these new parts in music that I had never heard before. It really is quite amazing. I'm not a super pro sound person, as these are my first pair of high quality headphones, but I am very satisfied with them. I'm taking these with me to college.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I purchased the headphones for my new voiceover studio. While the studio isn't up yet, I have tried out the headphones and they're excellent - comfortable and the sound is outstanding.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Probably my first 'serious' pair of headphones and I'm definitely happy with them. I bought them mainly based on other reviews and I do like them. They sound good and are also quite comfortable.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I compared this headphone to Klipsch in ear headphones and found a huge difference...everything is crisp and clear...amazing headphones for clarity, comfort and price

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Great headphones. The low end goes very deep and is great for second checking mixes when you don't have a subwoofer. Overall very even sound. They are a little tight to start off with but after a small break in, they become very comfortable.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I am using these for sound editing and mixing for a demo CD that my band is putting together. The overall sound is very good, much better than the more expensive headphones that I was previously using (made by a company that rhymes with nose). The build quality is fantastic as well - very sturdy. My only complaint is that I have to adjust the set o a regular basis to keep them fitting over my ears properly. This might change once they are worn in a bit more. Overall I am very happy with this purchase.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: For the price the quality cannot be beat
Item.Review: These are great headphones. The sound quality is superb, the build is strong, and they're extremely comfortable to wear. I use them either for mixing and recording my own music or listening to music through my iPod or laptop. In both situations these headphones excel. Highly recommended.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: The sound quality is Good specially the Low end . Comfort is also good. the only thing is that the top were the brand name is the leather gets wrinkly when wearing it looks like as if it wasn't well planed out by the design department. overall it's good but not exceptional

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I use this product for mixing and music production, and it is great. The thing that is really great about it is the optimal sound that you hear. These headphones have a wonderful balance from low res to high. They definitely helped me take my production to the next level, without being too expensive.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: After many hours researching headphones on the web, I finally decided to go with the ATH-M50's. I couldn't be more pleased! Not only are they the perfect monitoring cans, they are also great for listening to music and watching movies on my laptop.

Item.Item: Audio-Technica ATH M50 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: What can I say that hasn't been already said about these. I bought these solely based on reviews and raves on audio forums not just here on other sites also. I have yet to see one person talk about it and say that these are not worth the money and I'm happy to say my high expectations which were set by all the gleaming reviews have been met. So much so that I convinced a buddy of mine to buy these here.
